lines.text: If you continue to follow Madame Jarnac now, the consequeces may be serious.
That's what I had in mind,
Senor, I must warn you, I must command you - do not follow Madame Jarnac!

[Flippantly]
I'll tell you what. I thought it over and decided not to pay any attention to you.

Senor, I suspect that you were a very fine flyer and before that perhaps a promising shoe salesman, but you're a gross amateur at intrigue. You cannot expect to catch a trout by shouting at it from the riverbank proclaiming that you're a great fisherman. You need a hook with feathers on it.
She couldn't have made a mistake. I knew her well. Who betrayed her?
If there was any betrayal, I betrayed her by fathering her in a century of violence. She died well. Celeste made no mistakes.
What are you, French or German?
I'm an epicure.
[He offers Gerard food]
No, thanks.
A camp follower of culture. My blood is a mixture of excellent European vines. My ancestots have always been less interested in a woman's nationality than the quality of her complexion.
Where is the grave? I would like to see it.
The grave is the wind. Let the grave be the way we remember her.

[Insistent]
I would like to see it now.
[the sound of the wind is heard howling]

[after two kisses]
I could make you forget.

[Nastily]
But not for long and not enough. For that you've got to have a heart.
I'm afraid the Anglo-Saxon is a poor fanatic. He only takes action when you disturb his visceral emotions. He thinks with his gall bladder.

[Sarcastically]
We're stinkin' poor fighters too! We got lucky and plastered you off the map by accident.
Giving a party here is not as easy as it was in Europe. These romantic Latins are really a fraud - so placid and normal.
[Indicating the men in the room]
Look, not an ounce of intrigue in their blood.
I thought I noticed a little.
Oh, business and politics. You can't count that.
[Referring to marital infidelity and cuckolds]
Not more than three husbands will be compromised here tonight at best.

[Pointedly]
Who are the other two?

[Referring to the police]
I better stick around. They might be confused by all the bodies.
The gun is unnecessary, this is a friendly meeting.
Just want to be sure I'm chairman

There are still one or two good things left in this sordid world if one knows where to look for them. I'm afraid, however, that the quality of the liquor is holding up better than the quality of the women. You an American?
No.
Good. I find Americans a little abrupt in their approach to both subjects.
